chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Katherine Mae Krug was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.
With Huber. Release for standard conditions.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment.

**Attend Victim Impact panel meeting or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for non-attendance. Defendant states she already attended, Attorney to file proof with Court.
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katherine Mae Krug

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Katherine Mae Krug in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #4 is dismissed by operation of law.  Counts #1 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  HUBER:  50 days,  Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 5:00 p.m. on 6/9/16.

FINE: $1,229.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($2,500.00) and remainder to be refunded to poster).

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department. 

DL REVOCATION:  16 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK:  16 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  6/22/16.  Defendant states she already completed.  Attorney Schleis to provide/file proof.  Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failiure to attend Victim Impact Panel

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Katherine Mae Krug in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests an adjournment so Defendant can finish a program she is in.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Katherine Mae Krug in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Attorney Schleis makes statements regarding WCS letter.  State gives statements regarding WCS letter.  Attorney Schleis makes additional statements.  Court orders Defendant to continue to comply with bail conditions.   Bail remains as fixed. Previous court date sets remains on.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Non compliance with WCS. Br. 4 only.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Katherine Mae Krug in court with Attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests an adjournment so Defendant can continue with counseling and be able to accept the state's offer.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED on amended criminal complaint.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court. Defendnat to only be released during normal business hours and only to SCRAM to have the SCRAM installed.

Defendant Katherine Mae Krug in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
